text.p: Swiss shares ended weaker on Wednesday after a session which saw prices fluctuate within narrow trading ranges.
The market ran out of steam after a firm opening and turned lower when U.S. data signaled strong economic growth, share dealers said.
The blue-chip SMI closed 17.8 points lower at 4,625.6 and the broad SPI was down 8.40 to 2,927.32. SMI futures fell 28 to 4,626.
Roche, down 25 to 11,825, led the actives list. Novartis was down five to 1,780. The company is due to announce first quarter sales data on Thursday.
Overall trading volume was 1.88 billion Swiss francs.
Dealers said the market would remain volatile with U.S. markets determining future direction for the Swiss bourse.
Holderbank fell 21 francs to 1,116 reflecting market disappointment over last night's news that the cement producer planned to take provisions totalling 450 million Swiss francs.
Selected cyclical stocks like Fischer, Rieter, Saurer and Sulzer were firm for most of the session but also came under pressure when the broad market turned lower.
Banks and insurers suffered from an uncertain interest rate outlook.
UBS, down two francs to 1,322, holds its annual shareholders meeting on Thursday afternoon. Traders expected no surprises from the meeting.
